we're off at sun-up!" Clark looked firmly at the

The last man who went in there after
we've got to be wide awake from

The jungle night settled down like a shroud

the last outpost on the Uoang River!

S the Red African sun rose up over the
tangled Kongo Jungle, Clark Gregory
could be seen ordering black men, heavily
laden with packs of every size and description,
into line for a quick start into the forbidden
Makua country.

baje haastig!"

been caught.., But, unfortunately, once they

LARK GREGORY, the young world ad-
venturer, looked deep into the grey eyes
of Major Compton,
"Major," he smiled, "Professor Curtis and
myself .
thousand miles to find this fabulous elephant's
graveyard : .. and we're not turning back now.
We shall start first thing in the morning!"
The two men shook hands and parted. As the
camp settled down for the night, and the sky
